docs.lead_paragraph: LeBron James is just one example of a boomerang employee — one who leaves a job only to return. The practice is on the rise, and it is more welcome than it used to be.

headline.main: Employees Who Leave Increasingly Return to the Fold
headline.print_headline: Employees Who Leave Increasingly Return to the Fold

docs.abstract: Alina Tugend Shortcuts column; so-called boomerang employees, those who leave a job only to return, is a growing trend, as companies begin to see the benefits of rehiring a former worker; social media makes it easier to track down former employees, costs are reduced as firms bypass extensive search process, and companies mitigate risk by knowing what they are getting.
docs.snippet: LeBron James is just one example of a boomerang employee — one who leaves a job only to return. The practice is on the rise, and it is more welcome than it used to be.

docs.lead_paragraph: A campaign by the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention uses the threat of chronic disease, instead of death, to discourage smoking.

headline.main: Hard-to-Watch Commercials to Make Quitting Smoking Easier
headline.print_headline: Hard-to-Watch Commercials to Make Quitting Smoking Easier

docs.abstract: Andrew Adam Newman Advertising column observers that new anti-smoking campaign from the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention uses the threat of chronic and disfiguring disease, rather than death, to deliver its message.
docs.snippet: A campaign by the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention uses the threat of chronic disease, instead of death, to discourage smoking.

keywords.value: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention

docs.lead_paragraph: Social conservatives are moving to put abortion at the center of the midterm elections, despite warnings from other Republicans to tread lightly on social issues.

headline.main: Conservatives Hone Script to Light a Fire Over Abortion
headline.print_headline: A Script Honed to Light a Fire Over Abortion

docs.abstract: Social conservatives are moving to put abortion at center of midterm elections, despite warnings from other Republicans to tread lightly on divisive social issues; Susan B Anthony List, anti-abortion group of conservative women, hosts boot camps to talk about why abortion is wrong; social issues have taken on added urgency since Supreme Court's ruling in Hobby Lobby case.
docs.snippet: Social conservatives are moving to put abortion at the center of the midterm elections, despite warnings from other Republicans to tread lightly on social issues.

docs.lead_paragraph: A Georgia teen says in a civil rights complaint that she should have been allowed to complete her schoolwork from home while pregnant and on doctor-ordered bed rest.

headline.main: Teen's Complaint Seeks Schooling During Pregnancy
headline.print_headline: Teen's Complaint Seeks Schooling During Pregnancy

docs.snippet: A Georgia teen says in a civil rights complaint that she should have been allowed to complete her schoolwork from home while pregnant and on doctor-ordered bed rest.

docs.lead_paragraph: A former volunteer firefighter who hoped for a career in law enforcement was convicted Thursday of killing his pregnant wife, as jurors in his third trial rejected his claims that an unknown intruder shot her.

headline.main: Iowa Man Convicted of Killing Pregnant Wife
headline.print_headline: Iowa Man Convicted of Killing Pregnant Wife

docs.snippet: A former volunteer firefighter who hoped for a career in law enforcement was convicted Thursday of killing his pregnant wife, as jurors in his third trial rejected his claims that an unknown intruder shot her.

docs.lead_paragraph: A commonly used morning-after pill is suitable for use by heavier women, the European Medicines Agency said Thursday after a review of the evidence sparked by the French manufacturer's declaration that the drugs didn't work in women weighing more than 80 kilograms (176 pounds).

headline.main: EU Regulator: Morning-After Pill OK for All Women
headline.print_headline: EU Regulator: Morning-After Pill OK for All Women

headline.main: Do Personhood Laws Protect Or Harm?

docs.abstract: A debate is unfolding over a new Tennessee law that allows pregnant women who take opiates to be charged with assault.
